channel.title: LocalHost Problems
channel.description:
Hi guys, I'm having trouble getting the old Project Rainbow (3.4.6) client to play on my local host, I know I sound like an idiot cause this has to be the easiest thing on most clients to do. I know that I have to go into my GUI.java change the ip to either 127.0.0.1 or local host, and then go in client.java and do the same thing, making sure my ports are the same as my servers ports (43594). Now usually this works for me, however in this case it isn't. I've asked around and everyone gave me the same response, just to edit client.java but it isn't working. When I load my client up it is automatically set to the public servers ip (rainbow.servequake.com) like shown below
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2ecqfk0.png[/img]
My problem is that it will not let me edit the server ip, wether its in the physical client, or the client files. So could anyone help me? My purpose for all of this is to get a client update for the current Project Rainbow it has been stuck on 4.2 since last year and I have had enough. All I am trying to do is add my models and customs and so forth. so PLEASE could someone point me in the right direction?

item.title: LocalHost Problems
item.dc:creator: @Cript97 Cript97
item.description:
@Cript97 wrote:

@echo off & title Java Compiler :menu cls title David's Compiler echo Ryan's Client Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -Xmaxerrs 99 -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\InternetExplorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Compiling Finished. pause goto menu

I’ve got many but this one is probably the most detailed one.

Read full topic

item.title: LocalHost Problems
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

[quote=“Cript97, post:9, topic:480800”][quote author=Yesteryear link=topic=599038.msg4211679#msg4211679 date=1359661806]

Any compilers you guys recommend?[/quote]
wat. javac.e to the xe

Didn’t realize how dumb that sounded sorry, It’s just the way I have my compiler running it says it succesfully compiled, but the class files don’t change? I get 0 errors but when i decompile the class files theyre the exact same as the original. any idea what would cause this??[/quote]
Post your compile batch script then

Read full topic

Didn’t realize how dumb that sounded sorry, It’s just the way I have my compiler running it says it succesfully compiled, but the class files don’t change? I get 0 errors but when i decompile the class files theyre the exact same as the original. any idea what would cause this??

item.title: LocalHost Problems
item.dc:creator: @Cript97 Cript97
item.description:
@Cript97 wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:6, topic:480800”]A rather crazy idea but what if the Server IP and the port part of the login box are actually part of the login box sprite? Dun dun dun.

No but in all seriousness

[quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=599038.msg4211397#msg4211397 date=1359590155]
Did you compile?
[/quote][/quote]

That could be a possibility, and well I have a compiler not sure how good it is though :S that could be the problem eh? Any compilers you guys recommend?

EDIT: I went back and decompiled my class files to see if my compiler had changed anything, and wouldn’t you know it, you were right, but where do I find a compiler that actually works? I have the latest jdk so 7_11

Read full topic

item.title: LocalHost Problems
item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

A rather crazy idea but what if the Server IP and the port part of the login box are actually part of the login box sprite? Dun dun dun.

No but in all seriousness

3lv3n snip3r:

Did you compile?

item.title: LocalHost Problems
item.dc:creator: @Cript97 Cript97
item.description:
@Cript97 wrote:

Yesteryear:

Why do you think you can’t edit that server ip?

It will not let me, I’ve searched the entire client folder, and client.java specifically, and changed all rainbow.servequake.com to 127.0.0.1 and it still did nothing, it continues to connect to it and @3lv3n I tried all the usual stuff it will not let me.

Read full topic

item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

You can change the ip in the client files.

Read full topic
